effect.1: Entangled Variations demand constant, intense concentration to maintain, and any distraction can interfere with their operation.{{BR}}Whenever an unexpected surprise or other distraction causes the entangled Variation to shut down (or prevents {{NAME}} from activating it) in a way that creates a complication for {{him}}, {{he}} may take a Beat.{{OPTIONLIST:vars.options,this.selectedDeviations}}

effect.3: Entangled Variations demand constant, intense concentration to maintain, and any distraction can interfere with their operation.{{BR}}Whenever {{NAME}} suffers lethal (or aggravated) damage not caused by a Scar or Adaptation, whenever {{he}} Falters, or whenever {{he}} suffers the {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Stunned Tilt,json.tilts.stunned}} or the {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Distracted Condition,json.conditions.distracted}}, the entangled Variations deactivate unless {{he}} succeeds on a {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll. {{He}} may activate the Variation again on a future turn.{{OPTIONLIST:vars.options,this.selectedDeviations}}

options.tenuous: Tenuous: Whenever an attack or hostile action successfully targets {{NAME}} and either deals damage or imposes a deleterious Tilt, Condition, or other unwelcome effect, the entangled Variations deactivate unless {{he}} succeeds on a {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll.
options.unfocused: Unfocused: {{NAME}} cannot attempt to activate an entangled Variation if under the influence of a distracting Tilt or Condition (such as {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Deprived,json.conditions.deprived}}, {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Distracted,json.conditions.distracted}}, {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Frightened,json.conditions.frightened}}, {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Deprived,json.conditions.intoxicated}}, {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Insane,json.tilts.insane}}, {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Insensate,json.tilts.insensate}} or {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Stunned,json.tilts.stunned}}) without first succeeding on a {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll, which is allowed once per minute (once per turn, in action scenes).
options.afterEffect: Deviation - After-Effect: If {{NAME}} concentrates on directing the entangled Variation(s) for more than {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,{{VALUE:scarResistance}} turns,= {{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance,unsigned}}}}, {{he}} suffers the {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,{{DISPLAY:vars.afterEffectCondition}} Condition,json.conditions.{{USE:vars.afterEffectCondition}}}} when the Variation(s) deactivate.
options.selfDoubt: Deviation - Self-Doubt: If an entangled Variation deactivates because something broke {{NAME}}'s concentration, {{he}} may not attempt to activate it again until the end of the scene.
options.singleMinded: Deviation - Single-Minded: If {{NAME}} does not direct the Variation's effect at least once per minute (once per turn, in action scenes), it deactivates unless {{he}} succeeds on a {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll.

Once activated, {{NAME}} can deactivate an entangled Variation as an instant action, even if the stimulus persists, but it might reactivate a short while later (turns in action scenes, minutes in other scenes) if the stimulus is still present.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful Scar Finesse roll.
effect.2: {{INLINEOPTION:vars.option}}{{BR}}Any Variations activated in this manner are considered Overt for this scene.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Finesse,{{NAMEVALUE:scarFinesse}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} + Variation Magnitude}} roll.
effect.3: All entangled Variations activate involuntarily {{USE:vars.stimulus}} unless {{NAME}} makes a successful {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll. If exposure continues, the Storyteller may call for more Scar Resistance rolls — no more often than once per turn in action scenes, once every several minutes in non-action scenes — with a penalty equal to the number of consecutive successful Scar Resistance rolls {{NAME}} has made this scene.{{BR}}Any Variations activated in this manner are considered Overt for this scene.{{BR}}Once the Variations are active, {{NAME}} cannot deactivate them while in the presence of the stimulus. Getting clear of the stimulus often involves an instant action and a roll of some kind, depending on the circumstances.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Finesse,{{NAMEVALUE:scarFinesse}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} + Variation Magnitude}} roll.

options.insistent: Insistent: The Storyteller may activate one of the entangled Variations up to once per chapter. {{NAME}} may refuse this activation with a successful {{TOOLTIP:tiny-tooltip,Scar Resistance,{{NAMEVALUE:scarResistance}} + {{NAMEVALUE:acclimation}} - Instability Penalty}} roll. If this roll succeeds, the Storyteller may make another activation attempt in a later scene but may not attempt to trigger this Scar again during the current scene. Each consecutive successful roll to resist activation imposes a -1 penalty on future rolls to resist involuntary activation.

effect.1: {{NAME}} sometimes becomes someone else: {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}}.{{BR}}{{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} has an entirely different personality — including tastes, hobbies, and Aspiration — but it largely takes a live-and-let-live approach to their shared body: It won't ruin {{NAME}}'s life as long as {{NAME}} does it the same courtesy. Aside from the difference in Aspiration, {{NAME}} and {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} share all Attributes, Skills, and other traits. Each remembers what the other persona does, but only vaguely or as dreams. {{NAME}}'s player should control the character even when {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} manifests, although the Storyteller should feel free to feed {{him}} information only {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} would know.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may accept a Beat to change personas at a time when doing so creates a significant complication for {{him}} or {{his}} cohort — whether this places the {{NAME}} or {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} in command.{{OPTIONLIST:this.selectedDeviations}}

options.invoked: Deviation -- Invoked: {{NAME}} may voluntary yield control of her body to {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} as an action. This requires a turn in action scenes (a minute, in non-action scenes) and lasts the normal length of time based on Magnitude. This doesn't count toward the Storyteller's once-per-chapter limit.
options.inferiorPersona: Deviation -- Inferior Persona: {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} cannot activate Variations other than those entangled with this Scar.
options.superiorPersona: Deviation -- Superior Persona: {{NAME}} cannot activate any Variations entangled with this Scar. These are only accessible when {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} takes the reins.
options.bestial: Deviation -- Bestial: When {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} takes control, {{NAME}} loses touch with {{his}} humanity. Sapient thought eludes {{him}}, and {{his}} higher brain functions erode. At best, this causes stronger fight-or-flight instincts; at worst, it turns {{NAME}} into a mindless beast. {{DISPLAY:vars.alterEgoName}} suffers the {{TOOLTIP:tilt-card,Bestial Condition,json.conditions.bestial}}, which does not resolve until the end of the scene. {{He}} can't build equipment or plan ahead for a scene beyond the current one.
